name: TMNG Global
tag_list: telecommunications, telecom, cable, convergence, media, entertainment, bss, oss, bssoss, capital, consulting, strategycommunications
overview:
TMNG Global is a leading provider of professional services to the converging communications media and entertainment industries and the capital formation firms that support it. With a portfolio of solutions that include proprietary methodologies and toolsets, deep industry experience, and hands-on operational expertise, we tackle complex business problems and consistently propel our clients to profitable growth, optimal performance and sustainable competitive advantage.

TMNG Global’s companies: TMNG, CSMG, and Cartesian and our 600+ consultants, provide strategy, management, and technical consulting, as well as products and services, to more than 1,200 communications service providers, entertainment, media and technology companies and financial services firms worldwide. The company is headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas, with offices in Boston, Chicago, London, New Jersey, New York, Shanghai, and Washington, D.C.

TMNG Global has worked intimately at all levels â€“ from strategy to marketing to day-to-day operational management—with the leading players in every sector of this new communications world. We consistently assist our clients in successfully addressing transformational issues, whether the problem requires a new business model, the replacement of a legacy infrastructure, the selection of a new business system, or a marketing plan for a new product or service.

Our successful track record with market leaders in this evolving industry means our clients benefit from an unmatched depth of knowledge and practical experience. Our signature expertise in communications allows us to sense and respond to industry change and lead our clients through the transition. TMNG Global is singularly focused on helping our clients improve their bottom line performance, whether by designing new strategies, optimizing organizations and processes, or implementing new systems, operations, products and services.
